Key Match Events: Hridoy falls lbw to Rabada late on; Mahmudullah caught trying to hit six to win the match
South Africa post 113-6: Klaasen 46, Miller 29; Tanzim 3-18
South Africa win by four runs in a thrilling match
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa captain Aiden Markram: 'I think it got pretty nerve racking in the final over and it can make you mentally tired. Sometimes when you get on the right side it makes for good entertainment.'
Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto: 'I think this is a match we should have won. Last couple of overs they bowled well, it can happen in cricket.'
Player of the match Heinrich Klaasen: 'It was not a nice one to watch, it was good that the boys got it over the line.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The wicket is not too great for strokeplay.
David showed us how to bat on this wicket in the last match and we applied that today. We were about 10 runs short.
Alex Hartley on BBC Sounds: 'It's just tough for both sides to bat on this pitch and every game we've had have been low-scoring thrillers.'
Others: If following a Player Review request, an original decision of Out is changed to Not out, then the ball is still deemed to have become dead when the original decision was made. The batting side, while benefiting from the reversal of the dismissal, shall not benefit from any runs that may subsequently have accrued from the delivery had the on-field umpire originally made a Not out decision, other than any No ball penalty.
